intro: Monnina crepinii, commonly known as creeping monnina, is a low-growing annual herb native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often vibrant flowers. The plant features slender, branched stems that lie close to the ground, producing small, pinkish to reddish flowers in late spring. Its leaves are alternate, ovate to elliptic, and often have a slight pubescence. Monnina crepinii is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient plant in harsh conditions.
